thread.title: Maine Resorts Forecasting Up to 12 Inches in Saturday Storm
thread.title_full: Maine Resorts Forecasting Up to 12 Inches in Saturday Storm

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Maine Resorts Forecasting Up to 12 Inches in Saturday Storm
text:
By Mary Walsh ,
10 hours ago
A winter storm is moving into New England this weekend and Vermont, New Hampshire, and Maine are all forecasting snow.
Sunday River just shared an image from local Maine CBS affiliate WGME that shows a fantastic forecast for Maine snowboarders
"If you haven't made plans for Saturday yet, you probably should." posted Sunday River on Instagram.
The inland Maine resort received a few inches earlier in the week when a smaller storm rolled through Wednesday and Thursday. Temperatures dropped, allowing Sunday River to turn on its snowmaking, a beautiful thing considering the roller coaster weather the Northeast has had this winter.
WGME reported that the storm will begin between 2am and 5am Saturday morning and continue through 10pm-1am Sunday morning. The state's coastal region is only expecting 1-3 inches, potentially mixing into rain, but over a foot in the mountains has New Englanders waxing their snowboards and setting their stances back.
Follow along at @sundayriver on Instagram.
